question: How does Paul identify himself (2 Cor 1:1)?
choice: As a disciple of Jesus Christ
As an apostle of Christ Jesus
As a witness of Christ Jesus
As a believer in Christ Jesus

question: The book of 2 Corinthians was addressed as being from _______ (2 Cor 1:1)
The book of 2 Corinthians was addressed to the church at Corinth and _________ (2 Cor 1:1)?
choice: The brothers and sisters of Macedonia
All those in Asia and Pamphylia

question: How does Paul identify God in his greeting of grace and peace (2 Cor 1:2)?
In the greeting what does Paul express to the Corinthians from God their Father and the Lord Jesus Christ (2 Cor 1:2)?
God as Father is identified with what two actions (2 Cor 1:3)?
In what does God the Father comfort us (2 Cor 1:4)?
Why has God comforted us in our troubles (2 Cor 2:4)?
choice: So we can preach the gospel of peace
So we can be strong for those who suffer
So we can comfort those in trouble
So we can have compassion on all

question: What does Paul say flows into our lives (2 Cor 2:5)?
What does Paul say overflows from them (2 Cor 2:5)?
What does their comfort produce in them (2 Cor 1:6)?
What does Paul say is firm for them (2 Cor 1:7)?
Why does Paul tell the Corinthians they will share in Paul’s comfort (2 Cor 1:7)?
choice: Because they have shared of their wealth
Because they have shared in their sufferings
Because they have done what is right, just and fair
Because they love in all things

question: What will the Corinthians share in because they have shared in Paul’s sufferings (2 Cor 1:7)?
choice: They will share in their rewards
They will share in their victory
They will share in their comfort
They will share in their glory

question: What did Paul experience in the province of Asia (2 Cor 1:8)?
Where did Paul say he had experienced troubles (2 Cor 1:8)?
How great was the pressure Paul experienced in the province of Asia (2 Cor 1:8)?
choice: As much as the grace of God would allow
Far beyond his ability to endure
As much as they could stand

question: What was the result of the pressure in the province in Asia (2 Cor 1:8)?
choice: They wanted to flee for their lives
They prayed for protection and deliverance
They fasted and prayed without ceasing

question: Because of the pressure in Asia what did it feel like they had received (2 Cor 1:9)?
Why did Paul say they felt like they had received the sentence of death (2 Cor 1:9)?
choice: So they would learn patience and endurance
So they would become conquerors in Christ
So they would not rely on themselves but on God
So that their faith would be built up and made strong

question: From what does Paul say God has delivered them in Asia (2 Cor 1:10)?
How is God described when Paul is telling about the persecution he faced in Asia (2 Cor 1:9)?
choice: The God of mercy and grace

question: Paul says he has set his __________ that God will continue to deliver them (2 Cor 1:10)
On what has Paul set his hope (2 Cor 1:10)?
choice: That God would continue to deliver them
That God’s grace would flow to all who believe
That God would raise him from the dead
That all would stand before the judgment seat of Christ

question: How had the Corinthians helped Paul (2 Cor 1:11)?
choice: By their obedience to the gospel

question: For what would many give thanks (2 Cor 1:11)?
choice: That their faith had not been in vain
The answer to the prayers of many
The gifts of the Spirit given to all

question: How had Paul conducted his relationships with the Corinthians (2 Cor 1:12)?
choice: With righteousness and holiness in the Lord

question: What does Paul say testifies of how they had conducted themselves (2 Cor 1:12)?
What did Paul say he had not relied on in writing to them (2 Cor 1:12)?
What did Paul say he had relied on rather than in worldly wisdom (2 Cor 1:12)?
What did Paul not write to the Corinthians (2 Cor 1:13)?
choice: Anything they could not accept as God’s word
Anything they could not read or understand
Anything they could not do by the power of the Spirit
Anything they could not believe in Christ

question: What will Paul boast about (2 Cor 1:14)?
choice: The power of the Spirit in them

question: When will Paul boast of the Corinthians (2 Cor 1:14)?
choice: On the day of the Lord Jesus
The day he is put in prison

question: Why did Paul want to visit them first (2 Cor 1:15)?
choice: To give them a spiritual gift
So that they might benefit twice
So that they might know Christ

question: What did Paul want to do so that they might benefit twice (2 Cor 1:15)?
choice: Have them come to his aid

question: On his way to where did Paul want to visit the Corinthians (2 Cor 1:16)?
Where did Paul want the Corinthians to send him on his way to (2 Cor 1:16)?
What did Paul wonder if the Corinthians thought he was _______ saying “yes, yes” and “no, no” (2 Cor 1:17)?
What were the Corinthians thinking Paul said in the same breath (2 Cor 1:17)?
What did Paul say his message was not (2 Cor 1:18)?
How did Paul identify the Jesus Christ he preached among them (2 Cor 1:19)?
Who does Paul list as also preaching Jesus Christ to the Corinthians (2 Cor 1:19)?
The message preached by Silas, Timothy and Paul was never ‘yes’ and ‘no’ but ______ (2 Cor 1:19)?
What are ‘yes’ in Christ (2 Cor 1:20)?
Why does Paul say ‘Amen’ (2 Cor 1:20)?
choice: For the end of all things
To end his message of the gospel

question: What does Paul say for the glory of God (2 Cor 1:20)?
What does God make for both Paul and the Corinthians (2 Cor 1:21)?
How does Paul describe the Spirit being put in them (2 Cor 1:22)?
choice: As a forerunner of the coming redemption
As a letter of forgiveness sent to the king of heaven
As a deposit guaranteeing what is to come
As a rock upon which Christ’s church can be built

question: Paul lists all of the following as things God had done for them EXCEPT (2 Cor 1:22)
choice: Put his seal of ownership on them
Put his Spirit in their hearts

question: Who does Paul call as his witness (2 Cor 1:23)?
Why did Paul not return to Corinth (2 Cor 1:23)?
choice: In order not to hinder them

question: What did Paul not want to do to the Corinthians (2 Cor 1:24)?
choice: Make it too difficult for them

question: Why did Paul work with the Corinthians (2 Cor 1:24)?
What result does the Corinthians’ faith have (2 Cor 1:24)?
What did Paul make up his mind not to do (2 Cor 2:1)?
choice: Make another painful visit to them

question: What does Paul not want to do to the Corinthians (2 Cor 2:2)?
Why did Paul write them as he did (2 Cor 2:3)?
choice: So that he would not be distressed when he comes
So that they would not grieve him when he comes
So that they would not reject the gospel when he comes
So that they all would be one

question: What did Paul say the Corinthians ought to do (2 Cor 2:3)?
What confidence did Paul have in the Corinthians (2 Cor 2:3)?
choice: That they would not reject Timothy
That they would listen to him
That they would share in his joy

question: How had Paul written the Corinthians (2 Cor 2:4)?
choice: Out of concern for their well being
Out of his desire to see Christ at work in them
Out of prison and while he was in chains
Out of great distress and anguish of heart

question: Why had Paul written to the Corinthians with many tears (2 Cor 2:4)?
choice: To grieve them because of his sorrow for them
To help them grow in the grace and knowledge of Christ
To let them know the depth of his love for them
To get them to glorify God in all situations

question: What did Paul do out of great distress and anguish (2 Cor 2:4)?
choice: He sent Timothy and Silas to the Corinthians

question: What does Paul say is sufficient for the one grieving (2 Cor 2:6)?
choice: The grief that he has suffered
The repentance that he has shown
The grief of the community caused by him

question: Who inflicted the punishment on the one grieving (2 Cor 2:6)?
choice: The family of the one offended

question: Why should the one grieving now be forgiven and comforted (2 Cor 2:7)?
choice: So that he not do that offence ever again
So that he might understand the riches of grace
So that he not be overwhelmed by excessive sorrow
So that he may rejoin the community of believers

question: What does Paul tell them they should do now that the majority has punished the one grieving (2 Cor 2:7)?
choice: Bring him back into the fold
Restore and be reconciled to him

question: What does Paul urge them to do toward the one grieving (2 Cor 2:8)?
choice: Extend to him the right hand of fellowship
Anoint him with oil in front of the whole church

question: Why had Paul written to them (2 Cor 2:9)?
choice: To see if they would accept Silas in his place
To see if they would be obedient in everything
To see if they themselves would be forgiven in that day
To see if they would support Paul

question: Paul said he would forgive _______ (2 Cor 2:10)?
choice: If he believed in the gospel

question: Why did Paul say he would forgive the one whom they forgave (2 Cor 2:11)?
choice: In order that peace might reign in their hearts
In order that grace might be grace
In order that all might receive the forgiveness of Christ
In order that Satan might not outwit them

question: Of what does Paul say he is not unaware (2 Cor 2:11)?
Where did Paul say he had gone to preach the gospel of Christ (2 Cor 2:12)?
What had the Lord done for Paul at Troas (2 Cor 2:12)?
Why did Paul not have peace of mind at Troas (2 Cor 2:13)?
choice: Because he did not find Timothy there
Because he did not find Titus there
Because he did not find Luke there
Because he did not find Silas there

question: Who does Paul call his brother (2 Cor 2:13)?
Where did Paul go after leaving Troas (2 Cor 2:13)?
What does Paul praise God for always doing (2 Cor 2:14)?
choice: Forgives all their sins in Christ Jesus
Gives us a crown of glory for staying faithful
Leads them in triumphal procession in Christ
Provides for their needs in Christ Jesus

question: What is spread everywhere (2 Cor 2:14)?
choice: The fragrance of the knowledge of Christ
The glory of the Holy Spirit which is in Christ Jesus
The forgiveness of sins by the blood of Jesus

question: What are we to God (2 Cor 2:15)?
Among whom are we the aroma of God (2 Cor 2:15)?
choice: Among the rulers of this world

question: Among the perishing Paul says we are a __________ (2 Cor 2:16)
Among those who are being saved we are a ___________ (2 Cor 2:16)
What does Paul not do like so many others (2 Cor 2:17)?
choice: Use his position to rule over them
Peddle the word of God for profit

question: With what does Paul say he speaks before God (2 Cor 2:17)?
Like what does Paul speak with sincerity (2 Cor 2:17)?
choice: Like messengers in a burning home

question: Paul rhetorically asks if he needs what for the Corinthians (2 Cor 3:1)?
choice: A gift of the Holy Spirit for them

question: What does Paul say that Corinthians themselves are (2 Cor 3:2)
choice: Our children seen by the whole city

question: Where is Paul’s letter written (2 Cor 3:2)?
Paul says the Corinthians themselves are his letter. With what are they written (2 Cor 3:3)?
choice: With the Spirit of the living God
With the blood of the martyrs
With the sacrifices of the saints of Macedonia

question: On what is Paul’s letter not written (2 Cor 3:3)?
choice: The hides of sheep and goats

question: On what is Paul’s letter written (2 Cor 3:3)?
choice: The paper which will never perish
The memory of those at Corinth

question: Of what is Paul not confident (2 Cor 3:4)?
Of what does Paul say he is a minister (2 Cor 3:6)?
What does Paul say kills (2 Cor 3:6)?
While the letter kills, what does Paul say the Spirit does (2 Cor 3:6)?
Where was the ministry that brought death written (2 Cor 3;7)?
choice: Written by the finger of God
In the writings of the prophets

question: What could Israel not look on because of the glory (2 Cor 3:7)?
How does Paul describe the glory on Moses’ face (2 Cor 3:7)?
What will be more glorious than the glory of Moses’ face (2 Cor 3:8)?
choice: The righteousness which shall be revealed in them

question: Even what ministry was glorious (2 Cor 3:9)?
choice: That gave people the promised land

question: The ministry that brings what will be greater than the ministry that condemns people (2 Cor 3:9)?
How does Paul describe the greater glory (2 Cor 3:11)?
choice: The glory of that which lasts
The glory of the one and only Son of God
The glory of the Word of God

question: How does Paul describe the former glory that was engraved on stone (2 Cor 3:11)?
Why is Paul very bold (2 Cor 3:12)?
choice: Because of what he has heard about them
Because he has such a hope
Because he has confidence in them

question: What did Moses do while the radiance of the glory was fading (2 Cor 3:13)?
choice: Hid his face outside the camp of Israel
Put a veil over his face

question: Where does Paul say the same glory-hiding-veil remains (2 Cor 3:14)?
choice: When the servants of Christ are persecuted
When the old covenant is read

question: How can the veil be taken away when the old covenant is read (2 Cor 3:14)?
When does the veil cover their hearts (2 Cor 3:15)?
What happens even to this day when Moses is read (2 Cor 3:15)?
choice: Their response is scoffing and ridicule

question: When is the veil over their hearts taken away (2 Cor 3:16)?
choice: When anyone turns to the Lord
When they search for Christ Jesus

question: What is where the Spirit of the Lord is (2 Cor 3:17)?
What did Paul say he and the Corinthians reflect with unveiled faces (2 Cor 3:18)?
Who reflect the Lord’s glory (2 Cor 3:18)?
choice: All who have spoken to God face to face
All of those with unveiled faces
All who have seen Christ in the flesh

question: What is happening to those who reflect the glory of God with unveiled faces (2 Cor 3:18)?
choice: They are being transformed into his likeness
They are becoming holy even as he is holy
They are becoming the glory and majesty of God

question: Paul says, the glory comes from the Lord who is _______ (2 Cor 3:18)?
Through what does Paul say he has this ministry (2 Cor 4:1)?
What is the result of Paul’s having this ministry through God’s mercy (2 Cor 4:1)?
choice: He is encouraged in the Lord
He always rejoices in the Lord

question: What does Paul say they have renounced (2 Cor 4:2)?
What does Paul say they do not use in his ministry (2 Cor 4:2)?
What does Paul say they do not do in his ministry (2 Cor 4:2)?
choice: Force them to give money to him

question: What does Paul set forth plainly (2 Cor 4:2)?
To what does Paul commend himself (2 Cor 4:2)?
If the gospel is veiled to whom does Paul say it is veiled (2 Cor 4:3)?
What does Paul acknowledge may happen to the gospel to those who are perishing (2 Cor 4:3)?
choice: The gospel is the power of God

question: Who has blinded the minds of unbelievers (2 Cor 4:4)?
What can unbelievers not see (2 Cor 4:4)?
choice: The truth of the gospel which Paul preaches
The light of the gospel of the glory of Christ
The Holy Spirit as a dove descending upon them
The glory of the Father revealed in his Son

question: How does Paul identify Christ (2 Cor 4:4)?
What does Paul preach (2 Cor 4:5)?
How does Paul see himself in relation to the Corinthians for Christ’s sake (2 Cor 4:5)?
What did God say giving the knowledge of the glory of God (2 Cor 4:6)?
choice: Let every knee bow before the Lord
Let us love one another out of reverence to Christ
Let light shine out of darkness

question: Where did God make his light to shine (2 Cor 4:6)?
How does Paul describe the light given to us (2 Cor 4:6)?
choice: The grace of God shining on all
The knowledge of the glory of God
The revelation of the word of God

question: Where does Paul say we have this treasure (2 Cor 4:7)?
Why do we have this treasure in jars of clay (2 Cor 4:7)?
choice: To show the glory of the Spirit on his people
To show that the grace of God is honor not ourselves
So that we cannot boast of the gifts God has given to his people
To show the all-surpassing power is from God not from us

question: Paul says they are hard pressed on every side but not _______ (2 Cor 4:8)
Paul says they are perplexed but not _______ (2 Cor 4:8)
Paul says they are persecuted but not _______ (2 Cor 4:9)
Paul says they were __________ but not destroyed (2 Cor 4:9)?
What does Paul say he always carries around in his body (2 Cor 4:10)?
Why does Paul say they carry around the death of Jesus in their bodies (2 Cor 4:10)?
choice: So that all will know that there is a resurrection of the body
So that the life of Jesus may be revealed in their bodies
So that the healing power of Jesus may be manifest
So that everyone may have hope in the deliverance of God

question: What are we who are alive always being given over to (2 Cor 4:10)?
What does Paul say is revealed in his being given over to death for Jesus (2 Cor 4:11)?
choice: Sharing in the sufferings of Christ
Jesus’ life in our mortal body

question: Paul says death is at work in us which is in contrast to _______ (2 Cor 4:12)
choice: Life at work in the Corinthians
Forgiveness at work in the Corinthians
Righteous at work in all who believe

question: Paul says, It is written I believed therefore ________ (2 Cor 4:13)
With what does Paul say we have also believed (2 Cor 4:13)?
choice: With that same hope in Christ
With the anointing of the Spirit
With that same spirit of faith

question: Because of that same spirit of faith what does Paul do (2 Cor 4:13)?
Who will raise us with Jesus (2 Cor 4:14)?
choice: The Spirit which quickens the living and the dead
The Father of life and light who shines on all who believe
The one who raised the Lord Jesus from the dead

question: What will the one who raised Jesus do after raising us with Jesus from the dead (2 Cor 4:14)?
choice: Defend us before the judgement seat of Christ
Give us all joy in Christ

question: What is reaching more and more people (2 Cor 4:15)?
What should grace cause (2 Cor 4:15)?
What will thanksgiving overflow to (2 Cor 4:15)?
When does Paul say he doesn’t lose heart (2 Cor 4:16)?
choice: When he is preaching the gospel
When he thinks of the Corinthians
When he is outwardly wasting away

question: What does Paul say is happening day by day as he is wasting away (2 Cor 4:16)?
choice: He is restored as a precursor to the resurrection
Daily he rejoices in the Lord

question: What does Paul say the light and momentary troubles are achieving for him (2 Cor 4:17)?
On what does Paul say he fixes his eyes (2 Cor 4:18)?
What does Paul call what is seen (2 Cor 4:18)?
What does Paul call what is unseen (2 Cor 4:18)?
What do we have from God which is eternal (2 Cor 5:1)?
What does Paul point out about our house in heaven (2 Cor 5:1)?
choice: It is made without human hands
Its foundation is in the clouds

question: What does Paul say we groan for (2 Cor 5:2)?
choice: To be clothed with our heavenly dwelling
To walk the streets of gold
To witness the coming of Christ’s kingdom in power

question: Where does Paul say we groan (2 Cor 5:4)?
What does Paul say will happen to what is mortal (2 Cor 5:4)?
choice: It will become dust once again
It will be swallowed up by life

question: With what do we wished to be clothed (2 Cor 5:4)?
How does Paul describe God’s giving of the Spirit (2 Cor 5:5)?
choice: As the gift of God lest anyone should boast
As the power that raised Jesus from the dead
As a guarantee of what is to come
As the source of eternal life

question: When are we away from the Lord (2 Cor 5:6)?
choice: When we are members of the body of Christ
When we are at home in the body
When he has ascended into heaven
When his spirit has come on us

question: By what does Paul say we live and not by sight (2 Cor 5:7)?
Paul says we live by faith and not by __________ (2 Cor 5:7)
What does Paul say he would prefer (2 Cor 5:8)?
choice: In his heavenly body before the throne
Away from this world of woe and in the kingdom of God
Away from the body and at home with the Lord
With them in the presence of the Lord

question: Whether at home in the body or away from it what does Paul try to do (2 Cor 5:9)?
Where does Paul say we must all appear (2 Cor 5:10)?
choice: Clothed in the righteousness of Christ
Before the judgment seat of Christ
Before the throne of the Almighty

question: Why will we all appear before the judgment seat of Christ (2 Cor 5:10)?
choice: To be compared to the perfect lamb of God
To receive what is due us for things done in the body
To give praise and glory to God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ
To be purified as gold by the fire of God

question: Why does Paul try to persuade people (2 Cor 5:11)?
choice: Because he knows what it is to fear the Lord
Because he knows the judgment of God is coming
Because he knows the righteousness of God

question: What does Paul say is plain to God (2 Cor 5:11)?
What is Paul not trying to do again (2 Cor 5:12)?
choice: Write another lengthy letter to them

question: What is Paul giving them an opportunity for (2 Cor 5:12)?
choice: To forgive those who opposed them
To give money to the poor

question: What do those take pride in (2 Cor 5:12)?
Why does Paul say he is in his right mind (2 Cor 5:13)?
choice: It is for the sake of God

question: Why does Paul say he is out of his right mind (2 Cor 5:13)?
choice: It is for the sake of God
It is for the sake of the gospel
It is for the sake of all people

question: What compels Paul (2 Cor 5:14)?
Of what is Paul convinced (2 Cor 5:14)?
choice: That Christ rose from the dead
That one gave us the peace of God

question: For whom did Christ die (2 Cor 5:14)?
choice: For the sins of the world

question: Why did Christ die for all (2 Cor 5:15)?
choice: So that all may be saved
So that those who live should no longer live for themselves
So that righteousness may come on all who believe

question: What happened to the one who died for them (2 Cor 5:15)?
choice: He became a sacrifice for sin
He gave them peace with God
He paid the price for their sin

question: From what point of view does Paul not regard any one (2 Cor 5:16)?
What is a person who is in Christ (2 Cor 5:17)?
choice: One made in the image of God

question: What did God do for us through Christ (2 Cor 5:18)?
choice: Gave us hope of eternal life

question: What ministry was given to Paul and believers (2 Cor 5:18)?
What did God reconcile to himself in Christ (2 Cor 5:19)?
How did God reconcile the world to himself (2 Cor 5:19)?
choice: By bringing all people to himself
By giving us the spirit of reconciliation
By not counting their sins against them
By forgiving their sins by the blood of Jesus

question: What message has God committed to us (2 Cor 5:19)?
What role does Paul see himself and others in the message of reconciliation (2 Cor 5:19)?
In what sense is Paul an ambassador of Christ (2 Cor 5:20)?
choice: As though God was reconciling the world through him
As though God was making an appeal through him
As though God had put his words in his mouth
As though the Spirit of God was speaking through him

question: What do Paul and others do on Christ’s behalf (2 Cor 5:20)?
What does Paul implore them on Christ’s behalf (2 Cor 5:20)?
choice: Be holy as God is holy

question: What did God make him who had no sin for us (2 Cor 5:21)?
choice: To pay the price for us all

question: Why was Christ was made to be sin for us (2 Cor 5:21)?
choice: So that we might come before his glorious presence
So that we might be raised into newness of life
So that we might sing his praises forever
So that we might become the righteousness of God

question: What does Paul urge them not to receive in vain (2 Cor 6:1)?
In urging them not to receive God’s grace in vain, how does Paul identify himself (2 Cor 6:1)?
choice: As an elder of the church of Antioch

question: When did God say he helped them, quoting from Isaiah (2 Cor 6:2)?
choice: In the day of the Lord

question: What did God say he did in the time of his favor (2 Cor 6:2)?
Paul says now is the time of __________ (2 Cor 6:2)?
Paul says now is the day of __________ (2 Cor 6:2)?
What did Paul not do to discredit his ministry (2 Cor 6:3)?
choice: Ask for their support for selfish gain
Put a stumbling block in anyone’s path
Tie their hands with works of the law

question: Why did Paul not put a stumbling block in anyone’s path (2 Cor 6:3)?
choice: So that the Corinthians would not fall
So that his ministry would not be discredited
So that others would not have grounds to accuse him
So that the glory of God might be tarnished

question: In what role did Paul commend himself to the Corinthians in hardships and troubles (2 Cor 6:4)?
choice: As a preacher of the gospel

question: Paul commended himself to the Corinthians in all of the following ways EXCEPT (2 Cor 6:4f)
Paul commend himself to the Corinthians in all of the following ways EXCEPT (2 Cor 6:4f)
Paul commend himself to the Corinthians in all of the following ways EXCEPT (2 Cor 6:4f)
With what weapons did Paul commend himself to the Corinthians (2 Cor 6:7)?
Paul commended himself to them through all of the following EXCEPT (2 Cor 6:8)
Paul says they were genuine yet regarded as ________ (2 Cor 6:8)
Paul said, even though they were regarded as dying, what did they do (2 Cor 6:9)?
Paul says they were beaten but yet not _________ (2 Cor 6:9)?
Paul says they were sorrowful but yet _________ (2 Cor 6:10)?
Paul says they are poor yet __________ (2 Cor 6:10)?
Paul says they have nothing yet __________ (2 Cor 6:10)?
How did Paul say he communicated to the Corinthians (2 Cor 6:11)?
What did Paul say they did not withhold from the Corinthians (2 Cor 6:12)?
How does Paul say he speaks to them as a fair exchange (2 Cor 6:13)?
choice: As brothers and sisters in Christ
As those who have known him

question: What does Paul say should not be done with unbelievers (2 Cor 6:14)?
choice: Share the cup of the Lord

question: What does Paul say does not have fellowship with light (2 Cor 6:14)?
Paul asks what harmony Christ has with _________ (2 Cor 6:15)
What does Paul say idols have no agreement with (2 Cor 6:16)?
choice: The temple of the living God

question: What does Paul tell the Corinthians we are (2 Cor 6:16)?
choice: The temple of the living God
Priests of the most high God

question: Paul says we are the temple of God and God described his relationship with God in all of the following ways EXCEPT (2 Cor 6:16)
Quoting Isaiah, what did Paul say should not be touched (2 Cor 6:17)?
What did the Lord Almighty say he would become to them (2 Cor 6:17)?
What does Paul say should be the result of having these promises (2 Cor 7:1)?
choice: Let us strive for the prize in Christ Jesus
Let us walk in the light as he is in the light

question: From what should we purify ourselves (2 Cor 7:1)?
choice: From the temptations of the evil one
From that which stains the body and soul
From everything that contaminates body and spirit
From all the deeds of darkness

question: What does Paul say should be perfected (2 Cor 7:1)?
Out of what should holiness be perfected (2 Cor 7:1)?
What does Paul say should be done in their hearts (2 Cor 7:2)?
choice: Wash them in the blood of Christ

question: Paul says he has not done any of the following to anyone EXCEPT (2 Cor 7:2)
What does Paul say he would do with the Corinthians because they have such a place in his heart (2 Cor 7:3)?
choice: Comfort them with the comfort of Christ

question: What does Paul have in regard to the Corinthians (2 Cor 7:4)?
In what does Paul’s joy know no bounds (2 Cor 7:4)?
What happened when Paul and company came to Macedonia (2 Cor 7:5)?
choice: Their mind was troubled over the Corinthians

question: All of the following happened when Paul came to Macedonia EXCEPT (2 Cor 7:5)
Who does God comfort (2 Cor 8:6)?
How did Paul say God comforted him in Macedonia (2 Cor 7:6)?
choice: By their faith and good will

question: What had the Corinthians given Titus to give to Paul (2 Cor 7:7)?
The Corinthians expressed all of the following through Titus to Paul EXCEPT (2 Cor 7:7)
After hearing from Titus, what was Paul’s reaction (2 Cor 7:7)?
choice: His longing to see them was greater than ever
His joy was greater than ever
His sorrow was greater than ever

question: What had possibly caused the Corinthians sorrow (2 Cor 7:8)?
What did Paul not regret (2 Cor 7:8)?
choice: If his letter caused them sorrow
His time spent there at Corinth
If he could not come and see them
If they were fearful of his coming

question: What did Paul say his letter did (2 Cor 7:8)?
choice: Prompted them rejoice in the Lord
Hurt them but only for a little while
Told of the gospel of Christ

question: Why is Paul happy about his sorrowful letter (2 Cor 7:9)?
choice: Because their sorrow led them to obedience
Because they were true to the Spirit
Because their sorrow led to repentance
Because they received his letter with joy

question: To what did Paul say their sorrow led (2 Cor 7:9)?
What did Paul say God had intended for the Corinthians (2 Cor 7:9)?
What kind of sorrow brings repentance (2 Cor 7:10)?
What does godly sorrow that brings repentance lead to (2 Cor 7:10)?
What does worldly sorrow bring (2 Cor 7:10)?
What readiness did godly sorrow bring for the Corinthians (2 Cor 7:11)?
Paul says godly sorrow produced in the Corinthians all of the following EXCEPT (2 Cor 7:11)
What did the Corinthians prove at every point (2 Cor 7:11)?
Why had Paul not written to them (2 Cor 7:12)?
choice: On account of Paul’s sorrow over them
On account of the one who did wrong
On account of their idol worship

question: What did Paul want them to see for themselves in his writing to them (2 Cor 7:12)?
What was Paul’s response to the Corinthians being so devoted to them (2 Cor 7:13)?
About what had Paul boasted to Titus (2 Cor 7:14)?
choice: About the work of Timothy among them
About the repentance of the sinner
About their acceptance of the gospel

question: What did Paul say had proven true (2 Cor 7:14)?
choice: His prayers to God on their behalf
The message that he had preached to them

question: What caused Titus’ affection for them to increase (2 Cor 7:15)?
choice: When he saw their faith in the Lord
When he saw the work of God in their lives
When he saw the way they forgave the sinner
When he remembered they were obedient

question: How had the Corinthians received Titus (2 Cor 7:15)?
What does Paul have in regard to the Corinthians (2 Cor 7:16)?
What does Paul want them to know about (2 Cor 8:1)?
Paul wanted the Corinthians to know about the grace of God given to what churches (2 Cor 8:1)?
In the Macedonian churches, what welled up out of their extreme poverty (2 Cor 8:2)?
How much had the churches of Macedonia given (2 Cor 8:3)?
choice: Until they could give no more
Until Paul asked them to stop

question: For what did the Macedonian churches plead with Paul (2 Cor 8:4)?
choice: For Paul to stay with them until spring
For a copy of a letter Paul had written to them
For the privilege of sharing in the service of the saints
For the opportunity to travel with Paul to Jerusalem

question: In keeping with what did the Macedonian churches give themselves to the Lord (2 Cor 8:5)?
choice: Keeping with how the Spirit directed them
Keeping with what their elders had determined

question: What did Paul urge Titus to complete (2 Cor 8:6)?
choice: This act of grace on their part
This ministry to all in Macedonia
This preaching of the gospel to them

question: Paul compliments the Corinthians saying they had excelled in everything listing all of the following ways EXCEPT (2 Cor 8:7)?
What did Paul encourage the Corinthians who had excelled in everything to also excel in now (2 Cor 8:7)?
choice: The grace and peace of our Lord Jesus Christ

question: What did Paul not do wanting to test the sincerity of their love (2 Cor 8:8)?
By not commanding them what was Paul wanting to test (2 Cor 8:8)?
How did Paul say he was going to test the sincerity of their love (2 Cor 8:8)?
choice: By seeing how they accepted this letter
By comparing it with the earnestness of others
By urging them to support Titus when he visited
By commanding them to give more than that they were able

question: How does Paul describe the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ (2 Cor 8:9)?
choice: Though he was rich yet for your sakes he became poor
Though he was perfect yet for you he bore the yoke of sin
Though he was holy yet for your sakes he became unclean
Though he was sinless yet he became the atonement for sin

question: What was the result of Christ’s poverty (2 Cor 8:9)?
choice: They became part of the family of God

question: What were the Corinthians first to do (2 Cor 8:10)?
choice: Turn from their idols to the living God
Provide food and shelter for Titus
Give and to have a desire to do so
Repent and turn from their sins

question: What did Paul say they should match their eager willingness with (2 Cor 8:11)?
According to what did Paul encourage them to complete their giving (2 Cor 8:11)?
According to what is the gift acceptable (2 Cor 8:12)?
choice: According to the needs being met

question: What does Paul not desire in regard to others (2 Cor 8:13)?
choice: That they might be hard pressed

question: What is Paul desiring between others and the Corinthians in terms of their giving (2 Cor 8:13)?
What will the Corinthians’ plenty supply (2 Cor 8:14)?
What was written about the one who gathered much (2 Cor 8:15)?
choice: They did not have too much

question: What was written about the one who gathered little (2 Cor 8:15)?
choice: They did not have too little
They were generous with what they had
The Lord provided for their needs

question: What did God put into the heart of Titus (2 Cor 8:16)?
choice: The same hope that the Corinthians would repent
The same concern for the Corinthians that Paul had
A desire to help the poor at Corinth in spite of persecution

question: Into whose heart had God put the same concern Paul had for the Corinthians (2 Cor 8:16)?
How does Paul say Titus is coming to the Corinthians (2 Cor 8:17)?
choice: With the desire to preach and teach them
With enthusiasm and on his own initiative

question: How does Paul identify the person coming to Corinth with Titus (2 Cor 8:18)?
Why was the brother sent to accompany Titus and Paul (2 Cor 8:19)?
choice: To accompany them as they preach the gospel
To accompany them as they carry the offering
To accompany them as they distribute funds to the Corinthians
To accompany them as they care for the widows

question: What did Paul say they were doing to honor the Lord (2 Cor 8:19)?
choice: Give them the grace which they had received
Caring for the fatherless and widows

question: What did Paul want to avoid (2 Cor 8:20)?
choice: Any gossip and slander against them
Any criticism of the way they administer the gift

question: What was Paul taking pains to do (2 Cor 8:21)?
choice: What he had promised he would do for the Corinthians
What was needed by the church
What was right in the eyes of the Lord and men

question: Why was their brother zealous (2 Cor 8:22)?
choice: Because of the commission of Christ
Because of his desire to preach to the Corinthians
Because of his joy over the faith of the Corinthians

question: Who was zealous because of his confidence in the Corinthians (2 Cor 8:22)?
What two titles does Paul use in respect to Titus (2 Cor 8:23)?
What role did the brothers play (2 Cor 8:23)?
choice: They were representatives of the churches
They were guardians of the churches in Macedonia
They were caretakers of the offerings

question: What did Paul ask the Corinthians to show the brothers coming to them (2 Cor 8:24)?
What did Paul ask the Corinthians to show the brothers coming to them (2 Cor 8:24)?
choice: Their hospitality to all especially to Paul
The reason for Paul’s pride in them

question: What did Paul have no need to write them about (2 Cor 9:1)?
choice: This justification which had been offered them

question: To whom had Paul been boasting about the Corinthians’ eagerness to help (2 Cor 9:2)?
What did Paul tell the Macedonians about those in Achaia (2 Cor 9:2)?
choice: That they had responded in faith
That they were ready to give
That they were ready to suffer

question: Who did Paul tell the Macedonians were ready to give (2 Cor 9:3)?
What stirred the Macedonians to action (2 Cor 9:2)?
Why was Paul sending the brothers to Corinth (2 Cor 9:3)?
choice: So that all who see it might praise the Lord
So that his boasting about them would not be hollow

question: Why was Paul sending the brothers to Corinth (2 Cor 9:3)?
choice: So that they would be ready
So that their joy would be full
So that all might be moved to love and good works
So that there might be no need among them

question: Of what would Paul be ashamed before the Macedonians (2 Cor 9:4)?
choice: If they turned back to idols
If they had poor among them

question: What had the Corinthians promised Paul (2 Cor 9:5)?
choice: To stay true to the faith

question: What did Paul contrast to the generous gift the Corinthians had promised (2 Cor 9:5)?
Who will reap generously (2 Cor 9:6)?
choice: Those who have generous amounts of land

question: How much should each person give (2 Cor 9:7)?
choice: As much as they have decided in their hearts
As much as they can afford to spare
One tenth of everything they make
As much as demanded by those in need

question: How should a person not give (2 Cor 9:7)?
Who does God love (2 Cor 9:7)?
What is God able to make abound to you (2 Cor 9:8)?
What will be the result of God’s making all grace abound to them (2 Cor 9:8)?
choice: They will be full of grace to overflowing
They will be renewed in spirit
They will abound in every good work
They will prosper in everything they do

question: Whose righteousness endures forever (2 Cor 9:9)?
choice: Those who give to all who ask without sparing
The one who scatters abroad his gifts to the poor

question: What will happen to the one who scatters their gifts to the poor (2 Cor 9:9)?
choice: Their deed will be rewarded when Christ returns
Many will rise up and call them blessed

question: What does God supply to the sower (2 Cor 9:10)?
What will God enlarge the harvest of (2 Cor 9:10)?
Why does Paul say they will be made rich (2 Cor 9:11)?
choice: So that all may be blessed by their generosity
So that they may inherit true righteousness
So that they may be generous

question: What will the Corinthian generosity result in through Paul (2 Cor 9:11)?
choice: Their own needs will be met
The lifting up of the name of Christ
All praise and honor to God

question: What did their service that they performed supply (2 Cor 9:12)?
choice: The grace of God to many
Hope to those who were hopeless

question: What did their service that they performed overflow into (2 Cor 9:12)?
choice: Expressions of gratitude for their generosity
Expressions of debt for their kindness

question: What did Paul say their obedience accompanied (2 Cor 9:13)?
choice: Their loyalty to Paul and Titus
Their confession of the gospel of Christ

question: What will be the result of their service having proved themselves (2 Cor 9:13)?
choice: Others will be encouraged to such service
The church will rejoice in their faithfulness

question: How will hearts of those receiving the Corinthians’ service respond (2 Cor 9:14)?
choice: They too will preach the gospel

question: Why will those receiving the Corinthian generosity pray for them (2 Cor 9:14)?
choice: Because of their abundance and hospitality to all
Because the church had become one

Because the compassion of Christ was manifest in them

question: What does Paul thank God for (2 Cor 9:15)?
choice: For the grace extended to them in Christ

question: How did Paul appeal to the Corinthians (2 Cor 10:1)?
What had some falsely said concerning Paul’s demeanor when face to face (2 Cor 10:1)?

choice: Not with weapons of this world
Not with the deeds of darkness

question: What does Paul have divine power to do (2 Cor 10:4)?
choice: Knock down the walls of injustice

question: What pretension does Paul demolish (2 Cor 10:5)?
choice: The one that sets itself up against the knowledge of God
The one that comes from this world and opposes Christ

question: What does Paul take captive (2 Cor 10:5)?
To what does Paul take every captive thought (2 Cor 10:5)?
choice: To lay it at the feet of Jesus
To make it bring glory to God
To make it obedient to Christ
To conform it to the image of Christ

question: What is Paul ready to do once their obedience is complete (2 Cor 10:6)?
choice: Rejoice with them in all things

question: Paul tells them where are they looking (2 Cor 10:7)?
choice: Into the heart of the matter

question: What does Paul say he may boast freely about (2 Cor 10:8)?
choice: The authority the Lord gave him
His calling to preach the gospel to all
The ministry of reconciliation given to him

question: What authority had the Lord given to Paul (2 Cor 10:8)?
choice: The authority to build them up
The authority to pull them down

question: What did Paul not want to do with his letters to the Corinthians (2 Cor 10:9)?
What did some say Paul’s letters were (2 Cor 10:10)?

What did Paul say he would be in his actions when he is present (2 Cor 10:11)?
choice: What he is in their letters

question: Paul said that what he was in their letters when absent _________ (2 Cor 10:11)
choice: He would be in his actions when present
He would be gentler when he arrived
He would be more forceful when he visited

question: With whom did Paul refuse to compare himself (2 Cor 10:12)?
choice: With those who are after the flesh
With those who seek to lead them astray

question: Who did Paul identify as people who are not wise (2 Cor 10:12)?
choice: Those who run after the flesh
Those who turn away from righteousness
Those who measure themselves by themselves
Those who speak ill against the apostles and Christ

question: What did Paul call those who compare themselves with themselves (2 Cor 10:12)?
How does Paul not boast (2 Cor 10:13)?
What had God assigned to Paul of which he boasts (2 Cor 10:13)?
choice: A temple which will not pass away
A field that reaches even to the Corinthians
A rock of ages which cannot be moved
A promise of the coming of Christ for Paul and all who believe

question: With what did Paul get as far as the Corinthians (2 Cor 10:14)?
What does Paul describe as going beyond limits in his boasting (2 Cor 10:15)?
choice: Of the work done by others

question: What was Paul’s hope as they continue to grow (2 Cor 10:15)?
choice: That all would come to faith in the gospel of Christ
That Titus would bring them a blessing in the Lord
That Paul’s area of activity will greatly expand

question: What did Paul hope would happen as the activity among them would greatly expand (2 Cor 10:15)?
choice: That all Corinth would know of their faith
That their good works would be shown to all
That their faith would continue to grow

question: Where did Paul desire to preach (2 Cor 10:16)?
choice: In the regions of Pamphylia and Perga
In the regions beyond the Corinthians

question: Of what did Paul not want to boast (2 Cor 10:16)?

Of work done in the flesh and not by the Spirit

question: Paul cites the passage from Jeremiah “Let him who boasts boast in ______ (2 Cor 10:17)?
Who is not the one the Lord commends (2 Cor 10:18)?

The one who seeks his own glory
The one who slanders the gospel

question: What did Paul hope that they would put up with from him (2 Cor 11:1)?
What had Paul promised concerning the Corinthians (2 Cor 11:2)?

choice: In his desire that they all might follow Christ even as he had
In his jealousy for them with a godly jealousy

question: Who was deceived by the serpent’s cunning (2 Cor 11:3)?

By the fruit of the tree of knowledge of good and evil

question: What did Paul fear their minds would be led astray from (2 Cor 11:3)?

question: Paul defends himself saying he was not in the least inferior to whom (2 Cor 11:5)?
What did Paul say he was not trained as (2 Cor 11:6)?

Why did Paul lower himself (2 Cor 11:7)?
choice: To show them the humility of Christ
To request that they support the poor believers in Jerusalem
To lift them up to God by the blood of Christ

question: How did Paul preach the gospel to the Corinthians (2 Cor 11:7)?

choice: He worked in the shipping docks of the city
He robbed other churches receiving their support

question: When Paul was at Corinth who supplied his needs (2 Cor 11:9)?
choice: The brothers who came from Macedonia

question: What had Paul done in regard to receiving support from the Corinthians (2 Cor 11:9)?
choice: He had slept in a tent outside the town
He had kept himself from becoming a burden
He had given support to supply their needs

question: Who did Paul say could not stop Paul’s boasting about not taking any support from the Corinthians (2 Cor 11:10)?
choice: Anyone in the region of Macedonia
Anyone in the region of Asia Minor

question: How does Paul describe those he was trying to cut the ground from under at Corinth (2 Cor 11:12)?
choice: Those who were refusing to give because they were greedy
Those who had no concern for the poor in Jerusalem

question: Paul described his opponents at Corinth in all of the following ways EXCEPT (2 Cor 11:13)?

How do Satan’s servants masquerade themselves (2 Cor 11:15)?
choice: As faithful witnesses of the Spirit

question: What will be the end of the false apostles (2 Cor 11:15)?

In what does Paul say he is not talking as the Lord would (2 Cor 11:17)?

question: What is Paul talking as when he is not talking as the Lord would (2 Cor 11:17)?
How do many boast (2 Cor 11:18)?
choice: As the rulers of this world do

question: Satirically, why does Paul say they put up with fools (2 Cor 11:19)?
choice: Because they are trying to teach Paul

question: With whom does Paul accuse them of putting up with (2 Cor 11:20)?

choice: Anyone who slaps them in the face

question: What shame does Paul allege in the face of those exploiting the Corinthians (2 Cor 11:21)?

He was too timid for that

question: When does Paul say he is speaking as a fool (2 Cor 11:21)?

He was pierced by a crown of thorns

If Paul must boast, what will he boast about (2 Cor 11:30)?

He disguised himself as a Gentile and they did not catch him

question: When Paul goes on boasting what does he list with nothing to be gained (2 Cor 12:1)?

What happened 14 years ago to a person Paul knows in Christ (2 Cor 12:2)?
choice: He saw a vision of Christ
He received revelations from the Father

He was caught up to the third heaven

question: Of what was Paul unsure when he was caught up into the third heaven fourteen years ago (2 Cor 12:2)?
choice: Whether it was Christ or an angel
Whether he saw angels or people

question: Where does Paul say a person was caught up whether in or out of the body (2 Cor 12:4)?

What is the only thing Paul will boast about (2 Cor 12:5)?
If Paul chose to boast why would he not be a fool (2 Cor 12:6)?

question: Why does Paul refrain from boasting (2 Cor 12:6)?
choice: So that he would not be counted as a fool
So that he could preach the gospel with more power

question: Why might Paul have become conceited (2 Cor 12:7)?
choice: Because he was an apostle of Christ
Because he was called to preach
Because of the signs and wonders

question: What was given to Paul to keep him from being conceited about the great revelations (2 Cor 12:7)?

choice: As a mark of the sufferings of Christ
As a reminder of God’s grace to him
As a sign engraved in flesh

question: What did Paul do regarding the thorn in his flesh (2 Cor 12:8)?
choice: He asked the Lord why it was given
He pleaded with the Lord to take it away

question: What was the Lord’s response to Paul’s asking that his thorn in the flesh be removed (2 Cor 12:9)?

My love will be made perfect in you

question: In what did the Lord say his power was made perfect (2 Cor 12:9)?
Why will Paul boast in his weaknesses (2 Cor 12:9)?

So that Christ’s love might come to all
So that Christ’s power may rest upon him

question: All of the following are things Paul delights in EXCEPT (2 Cor 12:10)

choice: When he is in God’s will

question: Why did Paul say he made a fool of himself (2 Cor 12:11)?

question: Who did Paul say he was not the least inferior to (2 Cor 12:11)?

choice: Paul preached there only three times

question: Paul said he was ready to visit them for the _______ time (2 Cor 12:14)?

What had Paul not been to the Corinthians (2 Cor 12:16)?
By what had allegedly caught them (2 Cor 12:16)?

Who did Paul send to them (2 Cor 12:18)?

question: What did Paul fear about his coming to visit the Corinthians (2 Cor 12:20)?
choice: He would not find them as he wanted them to be
He would not find them ready to receive the gospel

question: Paul feared that he might find all of the following among the Corinthians when he arrived EXCEPT (2 Cor 12:20)

What would be Paul’s response when he visited in regard to many who have sinned and not repented (2 Cor 12:21)?
What did Paul fear when he comes to the Corinthians God might do to him before them (2 Cor 12:21)?
Paul describes the sin that many had indulged in as all of the following EXCEPT (2 Cor 12:21)?
What visit will this be when Paul comes after writing this letter (2 Cor 13:1)?
How many witnesses are needed to establish a matter (2 Cor 13:1)?
What did Paul give them when he was with them a second time (2 Cor 13:2)?

What were the Corinthians demanding proof of from Paul (2 Cor 13:3)?

That he would come to them again

question: How was Christ in his dealings among the Corinthians (2 Cor 13:3)?

question: By what does Jesus live (2 Cor 13:4)?
What does Paul do by the power of God (2 Cor 13:4)?

question: Why does Paul tell them to examine themselves (2 Cor 13:5)?
choice: To see whether they still are listening to Paul
To see whether they are following Christ

question: What does Paul want them to realize (2 Cor 13:5)?

question: Why does Paul pray to God for the Corinthians (2 Cor 13:6)?
choice: That they may become loyal followers of Christ
That others may see their good works and glorify God

question: Paul hopes they will do what is right even though what may appear to be the case (2 Cor 13:7)?
choice: Others have succeeded in deceiving them

question: What does Paul say he cannot do anything against (2 Cor 13:8)?

choice: He is humble but they are arrogant

question: Why does Paul write these things when he is absent from the Corinthians (2 Cor 13:10)?
choice: So when he comes they may rejoice together
So when he comes everything will be in order
So when he comes he won’t have to be harsh

question: Why had the Lord given Paul authority (2 Cor 13:10)?
